column2: As a Senior Illustrator in the eLearning domain, your role is to create visually engaging and informative illustrations that enhance the learning experience for students or trainees in an online or digital learning environment. You will collaborate with instructional designers, content developers, and subject matter experts to understand the learning objectives and translate them into compelling visual content.         Responsibilities:         Illustration Development: Create high-quality illustrations, diagrams, infographics, and visual assets that effectively communicate complex concepts and ideas in a visually appealing manner.     Conceptualization and Storyboarding: Collaborate with the instructional design team to conceptualize visual representations of learning content. Develop storyboards and sketches to outline the visual flow and design elements for each learning module.     Style Development: Establish and maintain a consistent visual style and brand guidelines for illustrations, ensuring alignment with the organization s eLearning objectives and target audience.     Graphic Design: Utilize industry-standard design software (such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, or similar tools) to develop illustrations and graphics. Apply principles of color theory, typography, and layout design to create visually engaging and cohesive learning materials.     Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with instructional designers, content developers, and subject matter experts to understand learning objectives and ensure that the visual content aligns with instructional goals. Provide input and guidance on the effective use of illustrations within the eLearning modules.     Quality Assurance: Review and provide feedback on the visual elements created by other team members to ensure consistency, accuracy, and adherence to established design guidelines.     Research and Innovation: Stay updated on emerging trends and best practices in eLearning design, illustration techniques, and technology advancements. Incorporate innovative approaches and tools to enhance the visual appeal and effectiveness of eLearning materials.     Project Management: Manage multiple illustration projects simultaneously, adhering to timelines and delivering high-quality illustrations within given deadlines.         Requirements:         Professional Experience: Several years of experience as an illustrator or graphic designer, with a focus on eLearning or educational content development.     Strong Illustration Skills: Proficiency in creating digital illustrations, infographics, and visual assets using industry-standard software. Demonstrated ability to translate complex concepts into visually engaging illustrations.     Design Expertise: Solid understanding of design principles, color theory, typography, and layout composition. Ability to create visually appealing and cohesive designs that align with instructional objectives.     Collaboration and Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, including instructional designers, content developers, and subject matter experts.     Creativity and Adaptability: Ability to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, and adapt illustration styles to meet the needs of diverse eLearning topics and target audiences.     Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality illustrations that are accurate, visually appealing, and aligned with instructional goals.     Time Management: Excellent organizational and project management skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and handle multiple projects simultaneously.     Portfolio: A portfolio demonstrating a range of high-quality illustrations and graphics, showcasing your expertise in the eLearning domain.         Experience:       7+ Years of relevant experience         Preferences:         Degree/ Diploma in Arts or relevant fields     Experience implementing illustration systems across platforms.     Work experience in tech/ product based eLearning companies     Experience working with animators
column11: Graphics, E-learning, Software design, Manager Quality Assurance, Illustrator, Illustration, Time management, Project management, Photoshop, Content development

column2: Job Location: Lead - DTP Experience: 7-10 years Location: M.G Road, Agra Job Description: We are seeking an experienced and technically proficient Lead DTP (Desktop Publishing) professional to join our team at Oswaal Books. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in DTP software and tools, coupled with expertise in managing DTP projects and teams. As the Lead DTP, you will oversee the desktop publishing process, ensuring both the timely delivery and technical excellence of educational materials. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Team Management : Lead and manage a team of DTP professionals, both internal and external, ensuring their productivity, growth, and adherence to project timelines. 2.  Designing and Quality Assurance : Ensure all designs and layouts meet brand guidelines, are visually appealing, and effectively communicate the intended message. Implement stringent quality control measures to ensure accuracy and consistency across deliverables. 3.  Process Improvement:  Continuously evaluate and enhance DTP processes by identifying bottlenecks and inefficiencies. Implement automation solutions where applicable to streamline workflows and improve efficiency.    4.  Communication : Communicating effectively with other teams and stakeholders, such as Editorial Managers and graphic designers to ensure that all desktop publishing work meets their needs and requirements. Also, connect with printing and other stakeholders to improve the print and production process. Requirements:  1.  Technical Proficiency:  Proficient in desktop publishing software such as Adobe InDesign. Familiarity with other tools like QuarkXPress and prepress software is desirable. 2.  Experience:  Proven track record in educational publishing with at least 7-10 years of experience in DTP operations, including project management and team leadership. 3.  Design and Printing Knowledge : In-depth understanding of typography, layout design principles, colour theory, and print production processes. 4.  Problem-Solving Skills:  Analytical mindset with the ability to identify technical challenges, propose solutions, and implement process improvements effectively. 5.  Leadership Skills : Strong leadership qualities with the ability to inspire, motivate, and mentor team members.  Join us at Oswaal Books and contribute to shaping the minds of the future.  Apply now! Share your CV at   recruitment@oswaalbooks.com / hrlead@oswaalbooks.com
column11: Desktop Publishing, DTP, Indesign, Layout Design

column2: Illustrator (Mid-level opening) JOB   TYPE:  Full-time LOCATION:  Bangalore, India TEAM:  Creative Design - India WHAT   YOU   WILL   DO We seek a motivated and creative individual with a passion for the impact sector. This role is for a creative and visual thinker who is ready to collaborate with a  multidisciplinary team of designers, public health experts, writers and behavioral researchers to create products and oversee medically accurate, culturally sensitive, and engaging content.  Creating High-Quality Visuals  Understand Project briefs and Conducting Visual studies across multiple states in India  Conceptualizing ideas for characters, scenes, backgrounds and other animation elements  Creating character sketches for new animations based on design briefs  Developing storyboards for animation and Live action projects  Collaborating with Film, storytelling and Visual Design team to finalise projects  Collaborating with multiple teams across the organisation to discover creative  opportunities and solutions WHAT   WE   ARE   LOOKING   FOR  2+ years of professional experience in a Creative consultancy, agency, or equivalent position  Portfolio featuring a diverse range of Illustration works and styles in print and/or digital media.  Willingness to learn and apply Human-centered design in day-to-day work  Willingness to learn about the Indian Health care system  Have a genuine empathic curiosity in how to communicate with diverse audiences,  particularly those with low literacy and living in rural settings  A firm understanding and grasp of Design Principles and a basic understanding of  human anatomy and proportion.  A keen eye for Visual Details  Great communication skills  Ability to follow brand guidelines and meet deadlines.  The ability to tell a good storyweaving together strategy, empathy, and narrative to bring stories to life in written and visual form  Proficiency in the Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator and other relevant software At Noora Health, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we understand the value of developing a team with different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences. We prioritise diversity within our team, and we welcome candidates from all gender identities, castes, religious practices, sexual orientations, and abilities  among many others. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for positions at Noora Health. HOW   TO   APPLY Email the following materials with the subject line  Illustrator   |   India  to people@noorahealth.org : or website link : https://noorahealth.org/careers/  A one-page cover letter describing your interest in the position and background.  An updated resume, including languages spoken and relevant experiences.  2+ Samples of a complete project with the Latest Portfolio www.noorahealth.org

column2: Skill required:Creative Services - Creative production and Graphics  Designation:Management Level - Analyst  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? Be a part of the Marketing Operations team that is leading the managed services arm of Accenture. We power our client's business through the integration of insights, data, and technology. We are focused on activating and scaling the best brand experiences, to deliver breakthrough marketing-led growth, cost-effectively, across all digital consumer touchpoints and channels. The value we bring to clients boosts their marketing efficiency and effectiveness that powers their growth. We're looking to hire passionate and innovative leaders in Marketing Operations with deep domain expertise in digital marketing and delivering cutting edge marketing services across a range of clients and industries, bringing with them strong operations acumen and transformative leadership. The visual design and development team is responsible for designing and planning the implementation of visual materials such as illustrations, photography, typography, space, layouts, and color. Visualizing and creating graphics including illustrations, logos, layouts and photos; shaping the visual aspects of websites, books, magazines, product packaging, exhibitions and more by using Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Corel draw.  What are we looking for? Ability to work well in a team Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: We are seeking a talented Illustrator to join our Curriculum Development team      The primary role of the Illustrator will be to create visually captivating and educational illustrations, graphics, and visual aids that enhance the learning experience for students in classes 6-12 across various subjects, including Mathematics, Science, English, Social Studies, Arts, Computer Science, Entrepreneurship, and Design Thinking                                Key Responsibilities:          Create Illustrations:    Produce high-quality illustrations and visuals that align with the curriculum and educational objectives for Mathematics, Science, English, Social Studies, Arts, Computer Science, Entrepreneurship, and Design Thinking across classes 6-12.        Collaboration:    Collaborate with Curriculum Developers, Subject Matter Experts, and Content Writers to ensure that illustrations complement the educational content effectively for all subject areas.        Adherence to Curriculum Guidelines:    Ensure that all illustrations meet the company s curriculum guidelines, maintain consistency, and follow the appropriate style and format for the target age group in each subject.        Adaptability:    Be adaptable in creating illustrations for print and digital formats, considering different mediums like textbooks, e-learning platforms, and interactive resources for all subjects.        Feedback Integration:    Accept and integrate feedback from stakeholders to make necessary adjustments and improvements to illustrations across various subject areas.        Research and Stay Updated:    Stay up-to-date with educational trends, pedagogy, and emerging visual technologies to enhance the quality of illustrations in each subject.        Qualifications:          Proven experience as an Illustrator or Graphic Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing educational and illustrative work across a range of subjects.      Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and other relevant tools.      Strong creative and conceptual thinking skills.      Good communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams on various subjects.      Knowledge of educational content development and the ability to adapt illustrations to meet curriculum requirements for Mathematics, Science, English, Social Studies, Arts, Computer Science, Entrepreneurship, and Design Thinking.      A bachelor s degree in Graphic Design, Illustration, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.      Passion for education, fitness, and sports is a plus
